review.title: Wonderful and helpful staff
review.reviewText: New lady at the desk with name starting with I think  K   was fantastic, friendly, helpful and very respectful..    She is great employee that shines in her role.

review.title: Good location really close to SFO but not noisy
review.reviewText: Spent two weeks there end July/start August.  Clean, comfortable and well positioned for exploring.  BART and CalTrain station really was 7 minutes away.  Good breakfast buffet.  Staff friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfort, staff. Very quiet despite SFO being under 2 miles away.
review.negativeRemarks: A small one - provide syrup for breakfast junkies like me!
review.locationRemarks: On El Camino Real - easy to go to SF or south, surrounded by restaurants mainly Asian style,  Very handy for the train - 7 mins easy walk.

review.title: Nicer than our expensive apartment
review.reviewText:
We very very impressed with our room at the Fairfield Inn in Millbrae. Not really a room, but it was a suite with separate rooms for sleeping and one for relaxing.  The room was very clean, well appointed and comfortable.
Great bed and pillows!
Best of all was the price; very reasonable for the Bay Area.  Great location, too.
Very close to BART, Caltrain and SFO Airport.
It is also a short easy trip to downtown San Francisco.
The only negatives, the last name on our reservation was incorrect, so it took a few minutes to find our booking.  And, it is close to Caltrain, so the train horns may be audible from some rooms.

review.title: Close to airport but overpriced
review.reviewText: Good amenities but a bit shabby and nothing out the ordinary.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good neighborhood, with some restaurant choices.   Biggest plus....is that it is a very nice hotel and very close to the airport !

We only stayed one night and didn't use the amenities.  The shuttle to the airport must stop at all the other area hotels as they said it would take 30 mins to get to the airport, so we took a Lyft and it was 10 mins.  Overall a nice hotel.

review.title: Not what we expected from a Marriott Hotel
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed here between our flights from Hawaii to Maryland. We didn't want to make the 12 hour trip so we spent the night in between trips at the Fairfield by Marriott at the San Francisco airport. We had been on a plane for 5 hours. We arrived around 11 pm and had to leave at 4:30 the next morning. When we arrived we got the key to our room. When we got to our room the keys didn't work. Went back downstairs for new keys. When we got in the room it smelled funny and the AC was broken. Back downstairs again for a new room. Got to the room only to find out that one side of the bed was so close to the bump out wall for the AC that my husband couldn't get out of the bed without bumping into the wall. We were so glad we only had to spend 5 hours in the room.
Did I mention the train going by at 3:30 am. The train was blowing the horn a lot.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The bump out wall was ridiculous. The ACs should be checked out to make sure they work and the rooms should not have an odor.
review.locationRemarks: Just stayed for a few hours so I can't say.

review.title: Easy access, friendly staff
review.reviewText: We dealt with four front desk staff over our stay and all were friendly and accommodating.  Access was easy (you ring for a shuttle from the hotel shuttle area at the airport - be aware that this is on the departure level of the international terminal NOT the arrival level - you have to go upstairs if you are arriving).  Our room was on the ground floor, overlooking the Chinese restaurant car park, but it was quiet enough given the location.  Very central to the BART, local restaurants and a Safeway up the road.  Fridge, microwave and coffee maker provided.  Free newspaper.  Breakfast quite good.  Gym had two runners a cross trainer and small set of free weights.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: We only spent one night in this hotel as we had to catch an early flight the next morning. The room was very clean and comfortable with a separate sitting area. The staff was very helpful. Complementary breakfast was provided which was very convenient, as was the free airport shuttle bus. A great place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The separate sitting room is great.
review.locationRemarks: Airport is close

review.title: Close to SFO, has a shuttle
review.reviewText: We needed a nice place to stay. This one came up at a great rate, one they couldn't match over the phone. We were very pleased with the room, it was clean and more like a suite. The seperate living room and desk made it easy for my wife to work. 2 tvs meant I didn't disturb her. The breakfast was excellent!
review.positiveRemarks:
Convenient to 
SFO
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO, shopping center  just down the road.

review.title: Reasonably priced near Half Moon Bay.
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and let us check in early, on the condition that we took a handicap room.  I would not want a handicap room again as the set up is a little different and not as cozy. I have heard from another hotel that Expedia bookings are being pushed toward handicap rooms. The parking is convenient and easy in a covered garage, which was great since it was raining! The hotel is clean and the breakfast was good and satisfying. The hotel is directly next to a Taco Bell which could be convenient if we did not have an immediate view of Taco Bell drive up. Being in a city you could hear sirens and traffic, but the beds were comfortable and we actually slept very well. I would stay here again as it is only 15 minutes to beautiful Half Moon Bay and 25 minutes to San Francisco without the City prices. The hot tub looked very enticing but it was raining hard, so we did not get to try it out.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff! Convenient, easy parking garage and a good breakfast!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Half Moon Bay, only a 15 minute drive. Near San Francisco, only 30 minute drive to Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: great location, right by downtown burlingame
review.reviewText: loved the layout of the room. we had two TV's, one in the living room and another in the bedroom. the gym didn't have much, but it was clean and all the equipment seemed new. the staff was very helpful and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: loved the gluten free cheerios included in the breakfast! everything was very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: we talked to someone in the elevator saying that their curtains were torn and their room smelt bad, but we didn't have any issues like that.
review.locationRemarks: blue line pizza - absolutely delicious, and it is in a fun downtown section

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,
Thank you for your recent correspondence regarding your stay with us.  We do appreciate hearing from our guests, as their comments are vital for us to continue improving our accommodations.
We hope to see you again in the near future.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean although a little run down. What I expected for what I paid
review.positiveRemarks: Online search
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom a little run down
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to amendment ties

review.reviewText: This hotel was close to the airport and my corporate office.  Check in was quick and easy.  There is a nice eating area where you can get a decent breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Access to freeway, airport and restaurants within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if there was a fire pit outside in the courtyard.
review.locationRemarks: Even though you are close to the airport, you don't hear a lot of air traffic. A lot of restaurant choices.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: This is the second time we stayed in this hotel. We like it because it is close to the airport and has some really great restaurants close by. Our favorite was O Solo Mio around the block. Lots of Asian cuisine. They let us leave our luggage in a storage room for the whole day until we had to cTch our plane for no charge.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, vicinity to airport
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is only so-so.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great restaurants, also close to a BART station.

review.title: A weekend getaway to visit family
review.reviewText: The hotel offers amenities that I need.  It is close to SFO airport and Bart/Caltrain station.  I can take the airport shuttle to SFO International Terminal to take the Bart to downtown San Francisco.  Even if I prefer to walk to the Bart station that is close to the hotel, it is a short walk.  The neighborhood offers a good selection of cuisine, in particular, Cantonese dim sum/seafood.  Complimentary breakfast offered at the hotel is also good.  There is a fairly good amount of breakfast choices.  As soon as certain items are gone, these items are instantly replaced by the staff.  Although my stay at the hotel is a short one but I like the location and what it is able to offer to guests.

review.title: Personal trip,room smells from ground,
review.reviewText: Personal trip,room smells from ground. It includes breakfast, internet, that beating. 10minutes walking to BART

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent. We enjoyed our stay. We will stay here agsin in the future and would suggest this hotel to others visiting the area.

review.title: Convenient for brief San Francisco visit
review.reviewText: We stayed twice at this hotel, when passing through San Francisco on a longer trip.  It has a free shuttle to and from San Francisco airport, and we used BART (a short walk from the hotel) to go into San Francisco and return.
review.positiveRemarks: Much less expensive than downtown SF hotels, yet convenient to San Francisco public transportation. Free short airport shuttle ride.  Good quality.
review.locationRemarks: Not much nearby, except good transportation.

review.title: Clean hotel,
review.reviewText: I loved the enormous amount of pillows. Awesome. There were plenty of eating establishments within walking distance. A great location

review.title: Location location
review.reviewText: Very good location 5 minutes from SFO with free shuttle. 5 minutes walk to Bart stations. Used Bart to AT&T park took 30 minutes. Shopping and dining with lots of options all within walking distance. Hotel staffs and conditions were average. Expect better for the rate they charge.

review.title: Very close to SF airport.
review.reviewText: Staff was nice. We had some plumbing problems, though. The staff came quickly and fixed the toilet each time. The sink however, would not drain well the entire week.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfy and they provided a nice simple breakfast. We had a microwave and refrigerator. I purchased pancakes and other food nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: The plumbing needs to be fixed and I heard the trash picked up very early one morning.
review.locationRemarks: Safeway was great to have down the street. The mall was fairly close. Our main purpose was to visit SF.

review.title: Easy access to airport
review.reviewText:
Good stay for a quick trip
There is a good restaurant next door
They are wonderful people and the rooms are very nice.

review.title: A Location we appreciated
review.reviewText:
We flew in and out of SFO.  Close to Milbrae BART and Caltrans we used both to go to San Francisco and down the valley. Transport never a problem.  A good Hyatt facility with staff very helpful - late checkout.  We loved the quieter ambience of Milbrae Village and there were excellent dining close by.  Hotel breakfast was ordinary but that seems to be the order of the day.
Recommended
review.positiveRemarks: Handy to public transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: As above

review.title: Nice hotel close to the BART station
review.reviewText: I had a lovely time at this hotel. Clean, well kept rooms. I like the fact that the room had a separate living area with a TV. It had nice bathroom amenities. The staff was polite. Their free breakfast had enough options to chose from.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the proximity to the BART station, their free continental breakfast and the shuttle.
review.locationRemarks: It's in a very nice area; walking distance to the BART station. It's located right by various restaurants that are open late.

review.reviewText: We chose hotel for proximity to airport and Park-N-Fly.  Very pleased with our choice.

review.title: Lovely
review.reviewText: Great room, nice location (near to bart station and safeway)

This was the last hotel during my 10-day California trip, but the most disappointing hotel. 
Clean and nice hotel facilities, but the airplane noise (day and night) was horrible. 
Hotel shuttle driver was very unkind. He yelled at my 12-year daughter and me, when we tried to help him unloading the baggage.

review.title: For the price it was OK
review.reviewText: We didn't spend a lot of time in this hotel but it accomplished what we needed - some sleep before an early race the next day. The room was overall was fine and the bed was comfortable. The staff felt a bit lost at times and were "just going through the motions" when I interacted with them (zero smiles or enthusiasm). The facility is not bad overall and the rooms are on the larger side which is nice.

review.title: Above expectations
review.reviewText: Party of four including two adults and two teens.  Accommodation surprisingly included a kitchen, dining space and sitting room.  Good dining options nearby such as a quality supermarket with fresh food ideal for simple preparation in the room. Excellent choice when visiting the Boeing centre which is a few minutes drive from hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality accommodation
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for Boeing visitors

review.title: Train horns, overpriced, terrible service
review.reviewText: This is a hotel 20 feet from the train tracks- need I say more?

review.title: Nice hotel with free airport shuttle
review.reviewText: Overall good experience.Shuttle times were good to get to and from the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff  were very helpful. Free wifi was good as was the breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in the bathroom was low. Hot water could do with being several degrees hotter.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located in Millbrae and a short walk to Bart, where you can get transport to the Tanforan shopping mall or into the city.

review.reviewText: Me and husband stayed for a weekend and we couldn't be happier. Loved how convenient it was to get around San Francisco. Just a short walk to the Bart Station and minutes later you're in the city. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasant and clean.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Millbrae. A short walk to the Bart Station :)

review.title: on the way out of town
review.reviewText: the hotel was close to SFO which was the main reason I chose it.  The room was clean , not particularly spacious, but not too cramped either.  good sized bathroom. Our window faced the drive up window of Taco Bell, but was actually not a noise problem.  wouldn't plan to stay for more than a quick overnight, but that was the point.
review.positiveRemarks: quiet
review.negativeRemarks: could sell wine  and/or beer in their "mini mart".
review.locationRemarks: near SFO airport

review.title: Clean Close to SFO
review.reviewText: Hotel is very convenient to SFO with a number of restaurants near-by. Hotel is clean and quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: Accessible to airport, near-by restaurants, and quiet
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants and airport

review.title: Hotel very close to the rental return at airport
review.reviewText: Very close to airport car rental return with regular shuttles to and from the airport. A nice modern and comfortable room with excellent bedding.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport - gym, spa and comfortable bedding
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Airport , restaurants and shopping very close by

review.title: Nice hotel close to Bart train & Caltrain.
review.reviewText: Close to airport, Bart train & Caltrain, lots of restaurants, gas station, basic residential area shopping. Room size is good with 2 LCD Tv. Hotel staffs helpful with all requests. Good selection of breakfast items, above average morning coffee. There are few things need attention: water pressure is weak, pillows are too soft (choice of pillows would be nice), better wi-fi signal is important, thicker bath towels, strong vent fan in bathroom would be nice. I look forward for stay in this hotel near future.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, public transit.
review.negativeRemarks: Real scramble eggs for breakfast, stronger water pressure in the shower, free parking for staying guest.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO, between downtown San Francisco & San Jose. Nothing much in Millbare. Convenience area.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: More modern room with clean lines, crisp sheets and a separate lounging area. My husband loved having a television in the living area and one near the bed. The airport shuttle and the closeness to the airport were the main reasons we initially chose this hotel. Unfortunately the shuttle didn't start until 4 a.m. - we had to leave at 3 a.m. - but the staff was kind enough to call a cab for us. This will be our only choice from now on when in San Francisco. A great value and a refreshing change. We highly recommend it.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Very clean. Convenient location next to airport. Nice to be next to CalTrain as well.

review.title: Nice hotel near business destination.
review.reviewText: Staff nice and helpful. Arrived late in the evening for early AM appointment. Room nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Parking used to be free and breakfast prepared to order... missed this.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants

review.title: Great "Airport" Hotel
review.reviewText: We had an early flight out of San Francisco. This hotel is very close to the airport and offers free shuttle service to the terminals. Everything workded like clockwork, making the early morning flight as easy as possible
review.positiveRemarks: Having a separate area from the bedroom to watch TV was great. The location practically next to the airport was also a big plus.

review.title: Convenient, clean hotel
review.reviewText: Nice place with several useful amenities and convenient transportation
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, convenient to airport and public transportation
review.negativeRemarks: More dedicated and professional staff especially night staff
review.locationRemarks: Some restaurants nearby. Very convenient to BART, shuttle to airport should be more frequent than every half hour

review.title: very convenient to the airport
review.reviewText: we enjoyed the neighborhood and had wonderful chinese cuisine just down the street from the hotel; also felt very safe walking to n from the hotel
review.positiveRemarks: its location / pleasant room

managementResponses.response:
On behalf of the entire staff at the Marriott Fairfield Inn & Suites SFO, we would like to thank you for your stay and comments!
We apologize that we did not meet your expectations and apologize that you did not enjoy your stay.
Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about our hotel.
We sincerely hope to see you again in the near future so that we can ensure you have a much more enjoyable stay!

review.title: Adequate, but too expensive
review.reviewText: The area around the hotel is packed with fast food businesses. Our window looked out to the drive in window of Taco Bell. I think the hotel has seen better days because the overall look was dingy and I resent paying that amount of money.

review.title: Great hotel close to SFO.
review.reviewText: Excellent room, staff, breakfast, and close to great restaurants. Staff very knowledgeable and pleasant. Free shuttle on time.

review.title: Nice hotel close to sfo airport
review.reviewText: Liked the hotel a lot. The breakfast was the only thing we didn't like. The eggs were runny and the sausage and bacon were swimming in grease.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel was very clean and the bed was very comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: Just breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and not very far from the city.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your comments, we are glad you enjoyed your short yet pleasant stay!

review.title: Six hours to rest before a midnight flight.
review.reviewText: Probably not able to say much other than it was the perfect location next to the airport without the airport noise. We were in the hotel for less than six hours. Good food within walking distance. A no effort stop that completely satisfied our requirements.

review.title: Near SFO
review.reviewText:
We didn't check in until late at night. We were incredibly exhausted and looking forward to sleeping. We were very frustrated that there weren't any parking spaces available and we needed to find street parking. *Hint - avoid paying for parking as there is ample, free street parking.
Our room was right above the Taco Bell drive-thru, so we were unable to go to sleep before 11pm any night.
We were freezing in our room and didn't realize that someone had left the window open until our second night.
My husband slipped in the tub. The bath mat was moldy. When I complained to the staff, they said that they would try to clean it and get it back to us. The bath mat was never returned.
The appliances made all kinds of weird noises during the night - even the TV remote.
The floors are very squeaky and we couldn't sleep as long as the people upstairs were in.
The hot breakfast buffet is entirely microwaved.

Pluses- good location, very safe. Delicious eateries nearby. Near the BART. Comfortable sitting area in the room. Free internet. Plenty of TV channels.

I've stayed in many Marriott hotels and found this one to be the most disappointing. It's okay for a cheap place by the airport, but I expected more from a Marriott.
review.positiveRemarks: Pluses- good location, very safe. Delicious eateries nearby. Near the BART. Comfortable sitting area in the room. Free internet. Plenty of TV channels
review.negativeRemarks: We didn't check in until late at night. We were incredibly exhausted and looking forward to sleeping. We were very frustrated that there weren't any p
review.locationRemarks: good location, very safe. Delicious eateries nearby. Near the BART. Lots of shopping.

review.title: pleasant stay for us
review.reviewText:
Hotel is at a convenient location. not far away from SF downtown and all scenic spots
a lot of Asian food around here.
Hotel spa and Gym facility are very good. .
Breakfast well prepared and coffee is good.
We enjoyed the stay.

review.title: Close to SFO for 1 night layover. Great steak near
review.reviewText: Check-in was a bit slow, but everything else about the hotel was fine. Good free wifi. Great steak at 16 Mile House a few minutes walk away, but you'd be wise to make a reservation. SFO shuttle runs every 30 minutes on a timetable.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything you need for overnight layover. fast free wifi. plenty of nearby restaurants
review.locationRemarks: Theres quite a vibrant community of shops and eating places nearby

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: All staff were very friendly and helpful. Close to the airport, shuttle service was nice and convenient . Just couple of blocks from the Bart station and 20 min ride downtown .

review.title: Convenient to BART
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very convenient to SFO and to the BART and CAL Train stations, which are within walking distance. It is also very close to hwy 101 which makes it easy to drive into the city.

The staff was pleasant and the under ground parking made having a car easy. Breakfast was typical, but hot and fresh.

We would probably stay here again if we came back to San Francisco. Just jump on the BART and you are at union square in a half hour.
review.positiveRemarks: Within walking distance to BART and CAL train
review.negativeRemarks: The AC fan was very loud
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get get to from Hwy 101, underground parking although not free made having a car easy

review.title: Convenient!
review.reviewText: The hotel is on a major street, with lots of nearby restaurants - just 2 blocks from the Millbrae BART and the Caltrain station - And it has a complimentary shuttle to the airport. The rooms had a sitting area and a bedroom area - with 2 TVs, a fridge, and a microwave - and there's a small outdoor headed spa. Breakfast is included. The only complaint I had was the overly-perfumed scent to the room - but we could open the window to air it out.

review.title: great for an overnihgt near the airport
review.reviewText:
great for an overnihgt near the airport
Good value. Free transfer
review.positiveRemarks: location and price
review.locationRemarks: cloe to the airport, convenient neigborhood

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a fantastic location, close to Bart, and restaurants and stores. The front desk staff however needs some people skill lessons. Not very friendly at all. One gal behind the desk on the last night we were there, was very personable, the other two nights, not a hello, or good evening , or good morning not even once!!! The room and hotel were very clean, however the air conditioning in the room did not work very well at night. The room became very stuffy even though we had the thermostat set at 71!! It was very uncomfortable and stuffy. Overall the hotel was good, just not very friendly staff.
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: hotel staff

review.title: Very pleasant hotel ambiance
review.reviewText: Very pleasant attentive staff, especially lobby and check-in; lovely comfortable room and bed, with balconey, WiFi; enough mirrors, good size desk and extra couch. Of course the weather is always great, but this is probably my 8th yearly visit to the hotel, for work in Napa, and it just makes it more pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The setting, beside the Napa River, with outdoor patio for eating and relaxing, spacious lobbly with small seating areas, balconey off the room
review.negativeRemarks: Since my last stay in March 2012, perhaps because of new ownership, breakfast is no longer complimentary. The items are pretty good, not too pricey
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to, very near "downtown Napa"

review.title: Why drive into San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location for getting into the city without use of a car. Only two and a half blocks from the Cal Tran and BART station. It is also very close to the SFO airport.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Highly recomended for every one, friendly hotel staff and shuttle service is on time.

review.title: Hotel great, staff not so much
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was great. The rooms were clean, the hotel was nice. What made the stay unpleasant was the unfriendliness, rude attitude of the staff. There were actually 3 members of the staff that were always dismissive about any request and never looked at you when speaking to you. Only one, Michelle (I think was her name, she worked late night) was kind, polite and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: The management and front desk staff with the exception of Michelle (late night staff person)

review.title: Satisfactory as a whole.
review.reviewText:
Staff services just bare, hair dryer not working, door key sometimes not working.

Breakdast acceptable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to airport and BART station.

review.title: Wish I'd known about this place earlier
review.reviewText:
First stay here. Stayed before on many occasions when in transit through SFO Int'l at the Millbrae Travel Lodge whose rates, over time, have gone from the justifiably inexpensive to the ludicrous. So, this trip I chose Fairfield Inn. Rooms are twice as big as those of the aforementioned (now known by the pretentious title of "The Dylan"). The place was spotless, comfortable, and the staff were most helpful. Aircon was a little noisy, though.
Sad to report, though, that my favourite Sichuan restaurant that was nearby has now permanently closed! No shortage of alternative places to eat, though.
This was my last trip to the US, but were I ever to return and needed a place close to San Francisco Int'l., this would most certainly be my first choice. Highly recommended!
review.positiveRemarks: Unpretentious. Comfortable bed. Helpful staff (who also miss the now closed nearby Sichuan restaurant).
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy aircon - frequent on/off to keep the temp. constant.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to SFO Int'l, but in a residential area with many very good Asian restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the quality of this hotel compared to the price
review.locationRemarks: Short distance to public transportation

review.title: Comforts of home
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Loved the suite, very spacious and clean. Bed was really comfortable. Located about 5 min walk from BART or CALTRAIN station so very easy to access downtown. I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: A very satisfied customer.
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was pleasing. We also stayed at a five star hotel the next night - paid more and got less. We will stay at thiis hotel in about a week.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of any.
review.locationRemarks: Great, just a mile from the airport!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Very Impressed and Reasonable price

review.title: Very pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText:
Very nice, clean room with comfy bed. Everything was very new and modern. Enclosed outdoor courtyard was nice.
I was very pleasantly surprised!

review.title: Good, quiet, dependable
review.reviewText: Good location next to BART Millbrae station. Breakfast amenities small, but functional. Exercise room same. Parking limited on street for guests. Rooms nice and clean. Free wi-fi. Will return when business in the Bay area calls again.

review.title: Excellant Airport Hotel
review.reviewText:
This is our second visit to this Hotel and it didn't disappoint.

The hotel shuttle arrived quickly and we were booking in within about ten minutes.
The rooms are of a good size and very comfortableMacdonalf, with a separate sitting area- ideal for eating a snack. There are are plenty of places to eat near by however after a ten hour flight we were happy to pick up a takeaway sandwich from the Safeway located a short walk up the road.

We wereonly staying the one night as we were off to Maui next day so used the free shuttle for the return trip to SFO.

Whilst the BART station is just up the road to get into San Francisco, we would probaly use a down town hotel if this was our first visit to the city.

review.title: Just in front of the airport. Very convenient location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is next to 101 so you can travel easily to San Francisco or San Jose.

review.title: a second toaster would improve services a lot
review.reviewText: fairly good airport hotel. I have decreased the overall satisfaction because of the out of the box breakfeast offered in a far too small room supported by a spanish speaking lady who did not manage to provide enough coffee for the guests. At another toaster would improve service by 100 %. This observation is based on a Sunday and a Monday breakfast at 8:30 am. In the face of the huge number of airport hotels around, I would opt for another one next time.

review.title: Convenience Hotel at San Francisco
review.reviewText: We have only two days at San Francisco and take flight to Las Vegas after the stay, Hotel is closed to subway take arround 6 minutes to the subway station, also has shuttle bus to airport that we can save time to arrange transport. Hotel is clean and comfortable, it is the best chose on our trip.

review.title: clean spacious room near airport
review.reviewText:
This hotel was located probably a 10 minute drive away from the airport and 20 minutes away from downtown which was convenient. The front desk staff was a little on the curt side when I called in seeing if early check in was a possibility but when we arrived they were friendly. The free continental breakfast was nothing to write home about, but it did save us some $. The lady that oversaw the breakfast area was incredibly sweet.

Our room was HUGE. There was a living room area with TV on one side then another side with the bed and another TV. You could easily fit 2 adults and 2 children here. The outdoor spa area looked like it was in need of some cleaning, there were leaves in the pool that kept increasing during the duration of our stay. There was an underground parking garage so that felt more secure, but I was a little disappointed because for some reason I thought parking would be free for hotel guests. The charge ended up being $6.95 a night though, which is cheap compared to downtown hotels.

review.title: Not a great neighborhood
review.reviewText: Close to airport, reasonable price and ok for a quick overnight.

review.title: good hotel, ok location
review.reviewText:
YOU'RE BETTER OFF STAYING IN DOWNTOWN S.F.
PRICE WAS GOOD, HOTEL GOOD, NEIGHBORHOOD NOT GOOD. OUR VIEW WAS OF SOMEONE'S BACKYARD. DIRECTLY OVERLOOKING RESIDENTIAL AREA.

review.title: Vic
review.reviewText: feel a little uncomfortable since the restroom located in middle part of the room

review.title: Would go back there and stay at the same hotel.
review.reviewText: Fairfield Inn was a very nice place to stay in Millbrae, our room was clean and the staff were eager to please.

review.title: fairfield millbrae
review.reviewText:
hotel staff are friendly.

lots of closeby restaurants, shops, etc. within walking distance. hotel also has an airport shuttle so getting to the hotel and going back to the airport is not a problem at all.
